productCategories.name: Bank
productCategories.description: I need a day to day transactional account

products.name: Business Current Account
products.shortDescription: A current account is the primary vehicle for managing the flow of funds in and out of an account.
salesHighlights: A current account provides easy access to funds
It supports widely accepted payment mechanisms, e.g. debit orders and electronic fund transfers.
It provides the facility to keep a record of transactions (statements are accessible)
It is a mechanism for accessing other, associated services.
Deposit and chequebooks can be offered in conjunction with the service.
It can be used as a billing account for various banking services, e.g. NetBank Business
significance: It provides transactional information on the flow of funds (i.e. statements)

productFeatures.name: Key Selling Points
productFeatures.description: > A current account is the primary vehicle for managing the flow of funds in and out of an account, without it transactions cannot take place. | > It provides transactional information on the flow of funds (i.e. statements).

productFeatures.name: Competitor Landscape
productFeatures.description: > A current account is a commoditised/generic offering used by banks to leverage brand and innovation.| > Other products can be sold in conjunction with it for the purpose of enhancing overall value delivered the client and growing bank market share. | > Nedbank is the only bank offering Affinity Cheque Accounts that contribute to the following worthy causes: | The Green Trust | The Arts and Culture Trust | The Sports Trust | The Nelson Mandela Childrenâ€™s FundYes Additional Cost.

productFeatures.name: Legal Documents Required
productFeatures.description: > Application for transactional current account - juristic person (company, close corporation, partnership, trusts) | > Terms and conditions of transactional current account | > Standard FICA process and documents as required by compliance (e.g. the process of verifying physical addresses and signature specimens)

products.name: NedTrust Account
products.shortDescription: The NedTrust product is an interest-bearing current account specifically designed for attorneys, to enable them to meet the requirements of the Attorneys Act 53, 1979 in respect of section 78(1) â€” the Attorneys Act.
salesHighlights: Nedbank can perform the calculation and reconciliation of interest and charges, on behalf of the attorney and pay the net interest automatically to the Regional Law Society.
Attorneys are allowed to off-set certain bank charges and service fees (excluding VAT) against the interest earned, prior to transferring the net-interest to the Attorneys Fidelity Fund.
significance: The NedTrust product is used by attorneys to deposit funds for the purpose of earning interest in terms of Section 78(1) Schedule 8.

The interest that an Attorney earns on funds deposited in the NedTrust account is not for the benefit of their business, practice or private account. It is for the benefit of the Attorneys Fidelity Fund.
The interest earned on the NedTrust Account is paid monthly, by Nedbank or the attorney to the Attorneyâ€™s Regional Law Society.
There are certain fees and charges that attorneys are allowed to off-set against the monthly accrued interest prior to payment being made to the Attorneyâ€™s Regional Law Society.

productFeatures.name: Target Market
productFeatures.description: This product is aimed at all practicing attorneys that need to operate an attorneyâ€™s trust account in terms of Section 78(1) of the Attorneyâ€™s Act 53 (1979).

productFeatures.name: Key Selling Points
productFeatures.description: > The account is fully compliant with the requirements of the Attorneys Fidelity Fund. | > Competitive credit interest rates are offered. | >Preferential cash deposit fees can be negotiated with CVM Pricing.| >Funds are accessible without notice.

productFeatures.name: Competitor Landscape
productFeatures.description: All four major banks provide this product, with competing interest rates.

productFeatures.name: Legal Documents Required
productFeatures.description: > Full FICA documentation as required for opening a current account. | > Valid Fidelity Fund Certificate. | > NetBank Business Application, Signature card, and the Master Electronic Banking Agreement (should this be required).

products.name: Business PAYU
products.shortDescription: This product provides a safe and convenient cashless payment mechanism for goods and services, a safe depository for excess capital and access to credit facilities on application. Clients only pay for the transactions they use.
salesHighlights: Low monthly maintenance fees, pay-as-you-use pricing.
Full transactional account with linked cheque card and electronic/mobile banking access.
Access to the full range of business solutions, including point-of-sale devices, financing and investment options and other value-added services.
Earn Greenbacks loyalty points on your card spend.
Reduces the need to operate with large amounts of cash.
Offers widely accepted payment mechanisms.
Monthly statement.
A vehicle for accessing other financial services
Debit orders and stop orders.
Electronic funds transfer.
Overdraft facilities on application.
significance: Provides full transactional functionality and options for an overdraft, a credit card and business lending.

productFeatures.name: Target Market
productFeatures.description: For new and established businesses (with a sound credit record ) within SBS, Business Banking and Professional Banking.

productFeatures.name: Key Selling Points
productFeatures.description: > This is a pay-as-you use account that gives you the flexibility to bank the way you want | > You only pay for the transactions you use | > Enjoy acess to the complete range of current account features and facilities, free balance enquiries on electronic channels, free internet banking statements.| > Allows a client to build a credit history for access to lending products.

productFeatures.name: Competitor Landscape
productFeatures.description: Similar products offered: | ABSA: Business Essentials | FNB: Gold Business Account | Standard Bank: Business CA

productFeatures.name: Legal Documents Required
productFeatures.description: > Application for transactional current account - juristic person (company, close corporation, partnership, trusts) | > Terms and conditions of transactional current account | > Standard FICA process and documents as required by compliance (e.g. the process of verifying physical addresses and signature specimens)

products.name: Business Enabler Account
products.shortDescription: The product is intended for business clients who do not qualify to open a normal Small Business Services CA, mainly due to a poor credit rating. The product is also aimed at start-up businesses that need to have a transactional bank account. Business Transactor will enable these clients to enter main stream banking and to build or improve their credit record and/or trading profile in order to increase the probability of being migrated to the normal Small Business Services CA at a later stage.
salesHighlights: Convenient banking through access to self service channels (Internet, branch, Cell phone (SMS and WAP) and Telephone banking).
Ability to make payments to third parties using any of the self service channels.
Use of debit cards at ATMs, Point of Sale for purchases, Petrol stations to pay for petrol and other supplies.
Competitive pricing that is simple to understand as most of the fees are flat fees.
Ability to get the eNote service (at a stipulated fee) in order to know when the debit card has been swiped and the transaction amount (there is a minimum amount that needs to be set).
Ability to build a credit history which will be useful for future credit applications.
significance: The Business Enabler is an entry level product, it allows clients the opportunity to build up a favourable credit profile. This account caters for fledging entrepreneurs looking to take advantage of the government tenders and other business opportunities but are prevented from obtaining a CA on account of not meeting the qualifying criteria especially as pertaining to the credit requirements.

productFeatures.name: Target Market
productFeatures.description: New and established businesses with no credit record and/or judgments against individual members.

productFeatures.name: Key Selling Points
productFeatures.description: > Provides a gateway to the SBS current account for businesses which do not qualify due to low or non-existent credit scores. | > Competitive pricing for day to day transactions | > Allows clients to build a credit profile available upon application

productFeatures.name: Competitor Landscape
productFeatures.description: Similar products offered: | ABSA: Bizstart | FNB: Business Super Save | Standard Bank: Bizlaunch Bundle

productFeatures.name: Legal Documents Required
productFeatures.description: > FICA documents (eg. ID, proof of residence);| > CIPRO documents;| > Memorandum of association;| > Minutes of board meeting (if applicable); and | > Financials.

filterGroups.filterDisplayName: What all features do you need

productLines.name: CashSolutions
productLines.description: A customised cash-handling service for your business.

products.name: Cash Online
products.description: Cash Online is an agile web solution for capturing cash deposits and cash withdrawals. It enables businesses currently using cash centres to make deposits or withdrawals through a cash-in-transit (CIT) carrier.
products.shortDescription: Cash Online is an agile web solution for the capturing of cash deposits and cash withdrawals.
salesHighlights: Secure login for users.
Capture deposits online.
Capture cash for cash requests online.
Receive the value of funds on the same day, even if it’s counted outside of core banking hours.
Tracking of a tamper-evident bag seal number online for enhanced security.
View and search for transactions, allowing for comprehensive management information.
Value-added services include cash acceptance devices, point-of-sale devices and a current account to process funds into.
benefits: Reduce time spent on reconciliation with online narrative capture.
Proactive cash centre participation ensures deposits are counted and not lost in transit.
Web-based printable audit trail allows for transactions to be checked instantly.
Enhanced manual cash banking processes allow for security and transparency..

value: Balances, statements, cheque/cash deposit images and cash management reports can be requested and reviewed
Statements can be downloaded and exported, instead of being printed
Batches of payments, transfers and collections can be created, imported and maintained

Single and bulk transactions can be captured and authorised by means of EFTs, future-dated and same-day-value (SDV) payment types and through the collection service. These payment and collection instruments with their different attributes enable beneficiary value to be provided or received earlier or on specific dates, with tracking capability.
Notifications can be used to inform a beneficiary of payment.
Beneficiaries and collectees can be added, imported and maintained.
With regard to self-service capabilities: client can reset user passwords, maintain and delete users, create nicknames for company accounts and customise proof of payment.

NBB provides flexible options such as self-imposed limits, account validations, single and dual authorisation for beneficiaries, collectees and users, account limits, settings and payments, eBill payments and transfers, combining safety measures and segregation of duty to ensure peace of mind. All collections allow for dual authorisation.
Security is a top priority with NBB, and therefore security tokens, software and hardware certificates and passwords are used.

products.name: Cash Vault
products.description: A device into which a client can deposit cash and which will allow the client to obtain immediate value from the bank on a collection of the device by a Cash In Transit provider.
products.shortDescription: CashVault.
salesHighlights: Counts multiple denominations through a high speed bulk note feeder.
Includes the high-speed CashRay® 90 banknote validator.
Has an LCD graphic interface.
Caters for dual responsibility for bag removal, audit trails, tracking ability, receipt and report printing, segregation of duties, cash processing and online deposit information.
benefits: Reduce onsite cash-handling risk and improve operational efficiencies.
This device is ideal for businesses with a daily cash turnover of between R250 000 and R1 million.
Accounts are credited electronically in accordance with the selected value proposition (Value for Value, Canister Upliftment Value or Device Deposit Value).
Includes maintenance, support, training and seamless client service for this device.
Acts as a criminal deterrent as a result of better security.

value: Balances, statements, cheque/cash deposit images and cash management reports can be requested and reviewed
Statements can be downloaded and exported, instead of being printed
Batches of payments, transfers and collections can be created, imported and maintained

Single and bulk transactions can be captured and authorised by means of EFTs, future-dated and same-day-value (SDV) payment types and through the collection service. These payment and collection instruments with their different attributes enable beneficiary value to be provided or received earlier or on specific dates, with tracking capability.
Notifications can be used to inform a beneficiary of payment.
Beneficiaries and collectees can be added, imported and maintained.
With regard to self-service capabilities: client can reset user passwords, maintain and delete users, create nicknames for company accounts and customise proof of payment.

NBB provides flexible options such as self-imposed limits, account validations, single and dual authorisation for beneficiaries, collectees and users, account limits, settings and payments, eBill payments and transfers, combining safety measures and segregation of duty to ensure peace of mind. All collections allow for dual authorisation.
Security is a top priority with NBB, and therefore security tokens, software and hardware certificates and passwords are used.

products.name: NetBank Business
products.shortDescription: NBB is Nedbank's electonic banking system for businesses. It can be accessed anywhere, anytime, through the internet or a mobile device, by means of the Nedbank App Suite. NBB Mobile is a business app for convenient, on-the-go transactions.
salesHighlights: Client enjoys mobility and security

Designed to be integrated into the client's existing line-of-business software, NetBank Business allows for more efficient transaction processing through an import capability and reconciliation that allows for the export of statement information
Clients have the control to maintaina nd update their NBB profiles and lists of beneficiaries/collectees
NBB is a fully modular system; clients only pay for what they use
NBB has an easy-to-use eLearning tool and provides context-sensitive help pages

productCategories.name: GetFinance
productCategories.description: I need money to help me achieve my goals

productLines.name: Loans
productLines.description: To start up, grow, offer flexibility or manage debt.

products.name: Overdraft
products.shortDescription: At times your business needs some cashflow flexibility – while you’re waiting for payments to come in, you need to make payments of your own. A Nedbank overdraft facility is the ideal solution, providing working capital finance and unlocking cashflow.
salesHighlights: Provides the flexibility to borrow or repay as and when your cashflow allows;
Making funds accessible quickly and easily through a variety of mechanisms
Calculating debit interest on the daily used amount only.
benefits: Easy access with electronic banking, ATMs and debit cards

Immediate access – as soon as your current account is active, you can apply for an overdraft facility and, once approved and the preagreed conditions are met, the facility is made available immediately

value: Assists clients with their daily cashflow
Provide bridging finance so clients can continue operating while waiting for incoming funds.

productCategories.name: CreditFacilities
productCategories.description: To meet a client's needs in offering a Credit Facility where the Financial Institution extends credit to another Involved Party in the form of actual funds' or as an obligation to provide funds in the future under specific conditions.  A Credit Facility is an Account in its own right e.g. a Line Of Credit.

productLines.name: LineOfCredit
productLines.description: Identifies a Credit Facility where the Customer is allowed a predetermined limit and may borrow as much of the &quot;line&quot; as required until the limit is reached. The borrower pays interest on the borrowed portion only with repayments linked to the amount of credit in use. As the outstanding credit amount is repaid the amount of credit available increases up to the original limit; for example' an overdraft on a current account' a commercial line of credit' a revolving line of credit.

products.name: RevolvingCreditLine(RCL)
products.shortDescription: Revolving credit line allows for a credit limit to be granted up front to be utilised by the customer over a period of time for predefined types of Vehicle and Asset Finance.
salesHighlights: Pre-approved amount made available to a specific borrower;
Borrower can take up any amount during the period of approval;
Borrowers can repay a loan when they have sufficient cashflow and take out a new loan when there is a need;
Loan amount is renewed as debt is repaid – fixed global loan amount;
benefits: Allows the borrower the freedom to ‘shop’ within a specific price range knowing the pre-approved amount they qualify for;
Quick and easy take up, no delays due to fresh credit applications;
Pre-approved, continuous funding mechanism allowing businesses the ability to acquire capital assets within predetermined rules.

productFeatures.name: Key Selling Points
productFeatures.description: > A current account is the primary vehicle for managing the flow of funds in and out of an account, without it transactions cannot take place. | > It provides transactional information on the flow of funds (i.e. statements).

productFeatures.description: > A current account is a commoditised/generic offering used by banks to leverage brand and innovation.| > Other products can be sold in conjunction with it for the purpose of enhancing overall value delivered the client and growing bank market share. | > Nedbank is the only bank offering Affinity Cheque Accounts that contribute to the following worthy causes: | The Green Trust | The Arts and Culture Trust | The Sports Trust | The Nelson Mandela Childrenâ€™s FundYes Additional Cost.

products.name: General Banking Facility (GBF)
products.shortDescription: A General Banking Facility allows for a Line of Credit to be granted to a customer accross multiple products, entities and/or accounts. The products that this line of credit can encompass are: Letters of Credit, Letters of Guarantee and Overdrafts.

productLines.name: Debtor Management
productLines.description: A range of solutions aimed at assisting growth-orientated companies to grow as our funding unlocks cash that had previously been tied up in the debtor's book. Companies that have a mismatch between debtor and creditor payments are ideal factoring clients.

products.name: Rental Discounting
products.shortDescription: Rental discounting is a product where Nedbank discounts/buys a Rental Agreement (also referred to as an operating rental) from a pre-approved client that could be either a Supplier or Financial Intermediary / Broker or bothIt provides the benefit of usage rather than ownership by allowing accounting firms to rent or lease desktop and laptop computers Types of Facilitie Standard Master Sale and Cession ( MSCA )Supplier facility on Nedbank paper Supplier facility on client paper Agreement of Loan ( AOL )

products.shortDescription: >A confidential debtor management solution you remain responsible for your own debtor ledger administration.  There will be no annotation on invoices or statements indicating that the debts have been sold to Nedbank.  Debtor payments must be directly deposited into a designated deposit account controlled by Nedbank.  This facility is usually used for businesses doing monthly sales in excess of  R1,5 million.

products.name: Factoring
products.shortDescription: A disclosed facility in which Nedbank Debtor Management carries out the complete administration of the debtors ledger, including the credit control and sending out of statements. Invoices and statements will record that the debt has been sold to Nedbank, to whom payment must be made. This facility is usually used for businesses that have a turnover of more than R500 000 per month, but do not meet the turnover.

productLines.name: Letter of Guarantee
productLines.description: A Nedbank letter of guarantee (LG/bank guarantee) is a contract that states that Nedbank will financially meet a commitment a client makes to a third party should the client default on payments or performance, in the case of a performance guarantee or once an action has taken place, in the case of a property guarantee or a demand guarantee. A letter of guarantee allows the client to offer the financial guarantee needed to secure a business deal that the client may not necessarily be able to acquire otherwise.

products.name: Letter of Guarantee
products.shortDescription: A Nedbank letter of guarantee (LG/bank guarantee) is a contract that states that Nedbank will financially meet a commitment a client makes to a third party should the client default on payments or performance, in the case of a performance guarantee or once an action has taken place, in the case of a property guarantee or a demand guarantee. A letter of guarantee allows the client to offer the financial guarantee needed to secure a business deal that the client may not necessarily be able to acquire otherwise.

productLines.name: Commercial Line Of Credit
productLines.description: Identifies a Line Of Credit whose purpose is to aid cashflow for corporate customers' and is not normally made available to retail customers.

products.name: Customised Trade Solutions (CTS)
products.shortDescription: Customised Trade Solutions (CTS) is Global Trade solutions that focus on: - Non-recourse ad hoc transactions - Structured trade finance facilities - The facilitation of complex cross-border trade instruments on specific pre-approved facilities - The identification and mitigation of performance risk - Transaction-centric initiatives

productFeatures.description: > A current account is a commoditised/generic offering used by banks to leverage brand and innovation.| > Other products can be sold in conjunction with it for the purpose of enhancing overall value delivered the client and growing bank market share. | > Nedbank is the only bank offering Affinity Cheque Accounts that contribute to the following worthy causes: | The Green Trust | The Arts and Culture Trust | The Sports Trust | The Nelson Mandela Childrenâ€™s FundYes Additional Cost.

productLines.name: Letter of Credit
productLines.description: Identifies a Credit Facility where the Customer is allowed a predetermined limit and may borrow as much of the &quot;line&quot; as required until the limit is reached. The borrower pays interest on the borrowed portion only with repayments linked to the amount of credit in use. As the outstanding credit amount is repaid the amount of credit available increases up to the original limit; for example' an overdraft on a current account' a commercial line of credit' a revolving line of credit.

products.name: Letter of Credit (LC)
products.shortDescription: Revolving credit line allows for a credit limit to be granted up front to be utilised by the customer over a period of time for predefined types of Vehicle and Asset Finance.

productLines.name: Credit Card Line Of Credit
productLines.description: Identifies a Line Of Credit Facility where the Customer accesses the line of credit by use of a plastic card which is widely accepted by retailers.

products.name: NedFleet Card
products.shortDescription: Card-based management system that enables control of expenses by providing the client with information to control his or her motor vehicle or fleet expenditure. Available irrespective of - where the client finances their vehicle - how they finance their vehicle - the size of their fleet Uses of the NedFleet card - Fuel and top up oil - Repairs and Maintenance - Toll roads - Excess on accident, if required.

productCategories.name: Access mechanism
productCategories.description: To meet a client's needs in offering an Access Mechanism whereby a customer can obtain access to another Product.

productLines.name: Electronic Service
productLines.description: This Service is offered by the Bank to clients' allowing them to access their bank accounts and/or third party accounts electronically.

products.name: TradeXchange
products.shortDescription: If a Nedbank client receives a Draft from an overseas payer, the Nedbank client will deposit the Draft at a Nedbank branch. This is called a cheque collection.  Nedbank will then organize for the money to be collected from the payers account and deposited into the Nedbank clients account.

productCategories.name: Borrowing money
productCategories.description: To meet a client's financial need to borrow money to facilitate the purchase of a small or significant asset -unsecured or secured.  This includes personal loans for incidental high value expenses to Vehicle and Home Loans.

products.name: Nedbond
products.shortDescription: A money lending facility offered by the Bank, whereby an amount of money is loaned to a client falling Outside NCA, who undertakes to repay the full amount of the loan over a pre-agreed term at a pre-agreed rate and instalments for the purchase of a commercial property or a loan against the security of an existing commercial property. The loan is secured by a first Covering Mortgage Bond. This facility can also be utilised to accommodate the development of commercial property (building bond).

productLines.name: Lease
productLines.description: A financial facility offered by the Bank whereby equipment and/or vehicles selected by the client' are purchased by the Bank and then rented onto the client.  Ownership remains vested with the Bank.

products.name: Leasing - Vehicles
products.shortDescription: A financial facility offered by the Bank whereby vehicles selected by the client, are purchased by the Bank and then rented onto the client over a pre-agreed term at a pre-agreed rate and instalments. Leases are quoted including VAT. Ownership remains vested with the Bank, however on termination the client has a choice to obtain ownership.

productLines.name: Rental
productLines.description: A financial facility offered by the Bank whereby goods selected by the client' are purchased by the Bank and then rented onto the client.  Ownership does not pass at the end of the agreement.

products.name: Operating Rental Agreement
products.shortDescription: A financial facility offered by the Bank whereby an Asset is selected by the client, purchased by the Bank and then rented onto the client over a pre-agreed term, pre-agreed rate and pre-agreed monthly kilometres where the asset is a vehicle. The instalment is calculated inclusive of admin fees. Rentals are quoted including VAT. Ownership remains vested with the Bank unless a manufacturer or supplier guaranteed buyback is in place.

productLines.name: Instalment Sale
productLines.description: Defined as a credit transaction entered into with a credit grantor whereby moveable' durable goods are sold to a consumer and all or part of the price is deferred.

products.name: Instalment Agreement - Imports
products.shortDescription: Defined as a credit transaction entered into with a credit grantor whereby moveable, durable goods are sold to a consumer and all or part of the price is deferred and is to be repaid over a pre-agreed term at a pre-agreed rate and instalments. The Bank will be importing the required merchandise/goods from the foreign source (supplier) on behalf of the client.  Ownership of the goods passes to the consumer on termination of the agreement by early settlement or at the end of the agreement period.  Interest fees and charges are payable to the credit provider in respect of the agreement. This product is available to legal entities falling Outside the ambit of NCA.

products.name: Instalment Agreement - Inside NCA
products.shortDescription: Nedbanks CFC accounts are available in all major currencies, the most popular of which are defined as a credit transaction entered into with a credit grantor whereby moveable, durable goods are sold to a consumer and all or part of the price is deferred and is to be repaid over a pre-agreed term at a pre-agreed rate and instalments. Ownership of the goods passes to the consumer on termination of the agreement by early settlement or at the end of the agreement period.
